tweet: Interesting patterns emerge when looking at $XMR nonces. Red overlay is mining difficulty.   Can you spot the ASICs?  H/T @100trillionUSD who did the same for BTC  https://t.co/s23WrdTIY0
Gaming store ‘accidentally’ adds Monero as payment option   https://t.co/1BU0VMuWxj
Epic Games founder: Fortnite’s move to accept monero was “accidental”  https://t.co/a6tc0EG7W5

@khannib @100trillionUSD the significance of this finding cannot be overstated. the XMR hard fork was a "natural experiment". this shows clearly that (some) ASICs perturb the randomness in nonce selection and that they evaporated post fork.

@MrHodl I'm not sure what you think that graph means, but what it actually means is that there were indeed ASICs, and the Monero community thwarted them. We wanted to fork Jihan's mother, and we did.  https://t.co/zSteeVDlxT

@CryptoPahmp Nobody scammed us, and in particular not Monero or the merchandise store partner. Epic guys were going through a big list of international payment methods without full context and didn’t realize the significance of that particular one.

Sincerely hope for Epic games to reconsider.  #Monero as an exclusive cryptocurrency payment option for Fortnite’s merchandise store has been an “accident”, says Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney.    https://t.co/FTePkOwG8G  $xmr #crypto #cryptocurrency #blockchain #bitcoin @monero
@Cryp_talking @Zerodium We do! We can pay in Bitcoin or Monero as stated in our Q&A section.

It seems likely that Monero unencrypted AND encrypted payment IDs will be disallowed in the fall 2019 upgrade. Blog post will follow after we gather more community consensus. Merchants should use subaddresses instead for superior UX and privacy.
